Sekiro was too hard, which for me made it not fun,  but a chore.

A chore is not fun, nor is it an escape from reality.

Gaming is about an escape, Sekiro for me missed the mark totally,  missed the point completely. 

What a waste.

snippet.textDisplay: Why am I watching this video ? Why am I interested in Sekiro ( Shadows Die Twice ) in 2024 ?. Well to answer those questions. I have almost completed Ghost of Tsushima Directors Cut on PC from "Suker Punch" and "N1XXES".  Yes set in medieval Japan. As soon as I knew Sony and N1XXES are involved, you know you are in good hands with a console port. Ghost of Tsushima is an absolute masterclass in an openworld RPG, that exudes in voice acting, an amazing immersive story, graphics are gorgeous. Combat is brutal but rewarding, but not Souls like difficulty. So i was looking for another game in a similar setting, so Sekiro came to mind as Steam has the GOTY edition. (Game of the year edition), just extra DLC as far as I am aware. But is Sekiro too difficult ? hmmm food for thought. It looks good. I am on the verge of getting it. Ok let me continue watching this video. Is Sekiro for the sado masochist gamer ?, I mean hundreds of attempts to beat the big bosses ? phew !! tough decision to make on a purchase of this game. looks good though, and fun.
snippet.textOriginal: Why am I watching this video ? Why am I interested in Sekiro ( Shadows Die Twice ) in 2024 ?. Well to answer those questions. I have almost completed Ghost of Tsushima Directors Cut on PC from "Suker Punch" and "N1XXES".  Yes set in medieval Japan. As soon as I knew Sony and N1XXES are involved, you know you are in good hands with a console port. Ghost of Tsushima is an absolute masterclass in an openworld RPG, that exudes in voice acting, an amazing immersive story, graphics are gorgeous. Combat is brutal but rewarding, but not Souls like difficulty. So i was looking for another game in a similar setting, so Sekiro came to mind as Steam has the GOTY edition. (Game of the year edition), just extra DLC as far as I am aware. But is Sekiro too difficult ? hmmm food for thought. It looks good. I am on the verge of getting it. Ok let me continue watching this video. Is Sekiro for the sado masochist gamer ?, I mean hundreds of attempts to beat the big bosses ? phew !! tough decision to make on a purchase of this game. looks good though, and fun.

snippet.textDisplay:
I hated this game for the first 3/4hrs, then slowly as the combat clicked I started to enjoy it. Up until Genichiro where I hated it again. 

Now iv probably done 2 new games and new game + about 5 times. Once the combat clicks it one of the most enjoyable games ever made. Definitely in my top 5 all time.

snippet.textDisplay: Inner Father remains the best boss of any action RPG. Sekiro has also inspired so many games now, most notably Sifu. Just one gripe - the second half of the game reuses the same areas, making us visit the same places and also has reskinned minibosses. That was more like Nioh than anything (I like Nioh too though). Never have seen FromSoft do that before as their environments and enemies are always different with limited reuses.
snippet.textOriginal: Inner Father remains the best boss of any action RPG. Sekiro has also inspired so many games now, most notably Sifu. Just one gripe - the second half of the game reuses the same areas, making us visit the same places and also has reskinned minibosses. That was more like Nioh than anything (I like Nioh too though). Never have seen FromSoft do that before as their environments and enemies are always different with limited reuses.

snippet.textDisplay: Few months ago i got elden ring. Absolutely adored it and played an uncountable amount of playthroughs with many challenges for myself. About a week or 2 back i got sekiro and have beaten it twice. Absolutely love it. Maybe even more than elden ring. It is 100% worth it to play. The combat might not click right away but unlike other fromsoft titles, in sekiro there isnt an 'easy mode' or a way out. You have to just fight them straight up.

snippet.textDisplay:
I‚Äôm playing this game currently on my first play through . 

Very fun , Challenging. 

However . The game has one fairly big flaw . 

It gives zero hints on how to do certain things . 

When it comes to unlocking certain areas i have had too look so much online it‚Äôs unreal . 

It gives you very little direction and that is very annoying . Having said that it‚Äôs a great game still .
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
I‚Äôm insanely in love with the game. Just played through it again a few days ago after 100-percenting it a few months ago
I have three little tiny complains about it tho
First is the spirit emblem system. I don‚Äôt think it benefit the game a lot by being a limited resource. It being limited between each rest is totally great, but I don‚Äôt think it has to be generally a limited item
Second is the grab mechanic. You have a counter move against every other moves from the enemy, other than the grab. Thrust is mikiri, sweep is jump, and grab is running away like a little b*tch yelling and praying it doesn‚Äôt magically sucks you in.. all I‚Äôm saying is dodging a grab isn‚Äôt as satisfying as dodging other moves
Lastly is some gang fights. I‚Äôm fine with most, since you can reduce the number of enemies if you play it smart and patiently. But some feels a bit tedious and hard like the drunkard fight, especially in the second memory. It may be a little much

Other than that, the best action game I have ever played. Love it
snippet.textOriginal:
I‚Äôm insanely in love with the game. Just played through it again a few days ago after 100-percenting it a few months ago
I have three little tiny complains about it tho
First is the spirit emblem system. I don‚Äôt think it benefit the game a lot by being a limited resource. It being limited between each rest is totally great, but I don‚Äôt think it has to be generally a limited item
Second is the grab mechanic. You have a counter move against every other moves from the enemy, other than the grab. Thrust is mikiri, sweep is jump, and grab is running away like a little b*tch yelling and praying it doesn‚Äôt magically sucks you in.. all I‚Äôm saying is dodging a grab isn‚Äôt as satisfying as dodging other moves
Lastly is some gang fights. I‚Äôm fine with most, since you can reduce the number of enemies if you play it smart and patiently. But some feels a bit tedious and hard like the drunkard fight, especially in the second memory. It may be a little much

Other than that, the best action game I have ever played. Love it

snippet.textDisplay: Nah this game is actually not that hard, the hardest thing is learning the rhythm after that you can feel allot more control over the fight although yes it very hard in the sense you will get punished for mistakes and bosses have bs damage, yes but one thing I'd did is grind a couple times for 2 extra skill points as in 5 leveled of XP to get sla couple levels of damage that really did help and balanced out my damage compared ti the busses as they still can destroy you it just evens the odds a bit better definitely not op by any means

snippet.textDisplay: Sekiro is super fun. There's really nothing bad about this game. However, don't simply pick up this game just because people tell you it is great. If you don't like other FS games, you probably won't like this game. When people talk about difficulty of this game, it is no joke. It's really hard, very very hard. When compared with recent games, it is at least the difficulty of Lies of P, if not harder.
snippet.textOriginal: Sekiro is super fun. There's really nothing bad about this game. However, don't simply pick up this game just because people tell you it is great. If you don't like other FS games, you probably won't like this game. When people talk about difficulty of this game, it is no joke. It's really hard, very very hard. When compared with recent games, it is at least the difficulty of Lies of P, if not harder.

snippet.textDisplay: tbh, I am pleasantly surprised.
snippet.textOriginal: tbh, I am pleasantly surprised.

snippet.textDisplay: yes, yes it is worth your time.  be warned, it is hard as nails, and of the soulsborne games, it is the hardest.
